intro: Orbea curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's orbea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Orbea curtisii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
